alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Grady, southern Caddo, southwestern Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland, southeastern Canadian and northwestern McClain Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 632 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to 4 miles northwest of Apache. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, western Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Anadarko, Mustang, Choctaw, Tuttle, Spencer, Nicoma Park, Minco, Apache, Cyril, Valley Brook, Verden, and Cement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 112 and 131. Interstate 40 between mile markers 143 and 166. Interstate 44 between mile markers 67 and 121. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma
